adjective.description: Engaging or ready to engage in physically energetic pursuits.
examples: I needed to change my lifestyle and become more active

adjective.description: Pursuing an occupation or activity at a particular place or in a particular way.
examples: the artist was active in the 1920s
tigers are active mainly at night
the old mill was active until 1960

adjective.description: Relating to or denoting the voice that attributes the action of a verb to the person or thing from which it logically proceeds (e.g., of the verbs in guns kill and we saw him).

noun.description: An active form of a verb.

origin: Middle English (in the sense preferring action to contemplation): from Latin activus, from act- done, from the verb agere.
